app.name: ClawSuite
app.one_liner: An all-in-one command center for orchestrating OpenClaw AI agents with full mission control, cost analytics, and mobile-first PWA support.

screens.name: Agent Hub â€” Mission Control
screens.purpose: Orchestrate multi-agent missions with isometric office view, live status, and lifecycle controls (spawn, pause, resume, abort).

screens.name: Agents Configuration
screens.purpose: Configure individual agent settings, models, and behaviors.

screens.name: Chat Interface
screens.purpose: Real-time conversation with agents featuring iMessage-style composer, model switching, and context bar.

screens.name: Cost Analytics
screens.purpose: Track per-agent spend, daily trends, MTD totals, and projected EOM costs using real gateway data.

screens.name: Cron Manager
screens.purpose: Schedule recurring agent missions or tasks using cron expressions.

screens.name: Dashboard
screens.purpose: Central hub showing gateway connection status, agent activity logs, cost KPIs, and quick access to all modules.

screens.name: Memory Browser
screens.purpose: Browse, search, and edit agent memory files (MEMORY.md and memory/*.md) directly in-app.

screens.name: Mission Wizard
screens.purpose: Step-by-step interface to configure and launch complex multi-agent missions.

screens.name: Skills Marketplace
screens.purpose: Browse and install agent skills from a curated library.

screens.name: Tasks Board
screens.purpose: Visual Kanban-style board for tracking mission subtasks and agent assignments.

screens.name: Workspace File Browser
screens.purpose: Split-panel file explorer with syntax highlighting for editing and saving workspace files.

rust_commands.name: dispatch_agent
rust_commands.purpose: Send mission payload to OpenClaw Gateway via /api/agent-dispatch RPC.

rust_commands.name: fetch_costs
rust_commands.purpose: Query SQLite-backed cost analytics data for dashboard rendering.

rust_commands.name: list_items
rust_commands.purpose: Retrieve directory contents for the Workspace File Browser.

rust_commands.name: save_item
rust_commands.purpose: Persist user-edited files or configurations to disk via Tauri backend.

rust_commands.name: steer_agent
rust_commands.purpose: Send real-time steering signal to active agent via chat.send fallback.

mvp_plan: week 1: Build basic Agent Hub screen with static mock data
week 1: Implement core auth middleware and secure API routes
week 1: Set up Tauri + React + TypeScript base
week 2: Connect to OpenClaw Gateway via /api/agent-dispatch
week 2: Implement exec approval modal with countdown
week 2: Integrate SSE streaming for live agent output
week 3: Add mobile-responsive chat with iMessage-style composer
week 3: Develop Cost Analytics page with SQLite backend
week 3: Implement context alert modal at 50%/75%/90% thresholds
week 4: Add Workspace File Browser with Monaco editor
week 4: Build Memory Browser with file editing
week 4: Implement dark mode theming across all screens
acceptance_tests: Cost Analytics page loads real data from SQLite, showing per-agent spend, 30-day trend chart, and per-model usage table.
Memory Browser allows searching and editing MEMORY.md files with immediate save persistence.
Mission Control displays live agent status badges and allows pausing/resuming via real steer signals sent through chat.send fallback.
On mobile, the chat composer remains docked edge-to-edge when keyboard appears, and the action sheet does not collapse during file selection.
When agent usage reaches 75%, a context alert modal appears and persists until dismissed; the state is stored in sessionStorage per day.
